Crimes.Legal_Issue: Adverse credibility findings and breach of natural justice
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Contradictions and implausibilities in testimony, selective memory, lack of documentation
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Lack of corroborative evidence, absence of documents proving husband’s military status
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Persecution due to husband's military affiliation
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Failure to provide key documents despite ample time
Crimes.Application_Error: Misrepresentation through inconsistent statements and lack of proof
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Credibility assessed based on internal consistency and plausibility
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: None identified – applicant failed to produce evidence
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Patent unreasonableness standard applied by reviewing court
Crimes.Application_Factor: Burden of proof on applicant to establish credible basis for claim
Crimes.Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Whether adverse credibility findings were patently unreasonable
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Board has jurisdiction to assess credibility; findings must not rely on irrelevant considerations
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of credible evidence supporting persecution claim
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Absence of documentation, lack of corroboration
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: No breach of natural justice found
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Misrepresentation in border or supporting documents
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claimant challenged credibility assessment and procedural fairness
